title: Maladex: Algorithmic Swaps Protocol
description: 提案されているカルダノDEXモデルは、資本効率が低く、無期限の損失が大きく、並行処理に苦慮しがちな非効率なモデルです。

f6_assessments.q0: A well working DEX definitely meets the challenge. If Cardano can have one which is better than other competitors it will drive users here. The proposer believes there are a number of issues with current and proposed DEX's. He intends to further research solutions to some of these issues and build a better solution. The proposal itself could be more concise and the flaws of other exchanges and proposed solutions clearly stated at the beginning rather than starting with a glossary of terms. It takes a long time to get to what the proposal will do, and even then it in not 100% clear the proposer has the solutions clear in his mind.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer is obviously highly motivated by this problem, already expending effort on the solution. He has great background on the subject matter, though it is less clear he has the technical expertise to code up a robust real-time trading platform. I have a similar background in trading at large investment banks, quantitative finance degrees and a PhD in Robotics and AI and understand what he is trying to achieve, however the proposal lacks some clarity which worries me in terms of his ability to deliver such a complex project on time and within budget. Some of the core problems he wishes to solve are still open research question, thus successful delivery cannot be considered highly likely. Perhaps a smaller research proposal to research the best solutions to the problems outlined would be a better first step and more likely of being funded?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has clear aims for what it wants to produce, which are thus auditable. Perhaps it could also have some goals for volumes going through it at various stages against which success could be measured.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal effectively addresses the challenge, which is to grow DeFi Cardano space by providing novel approach to DEX. The proposal tackles low capital efficiency, high impermanent loss and concurrency with novel Algorithmic Automated Market Making (AAMM) protocol dynamically adjusting to the market. Such approach looks different than porting of existing ETH solutions.

The Cardano ecosystem will benefit with easier and more friendly Liquidity Providing then competition which can in turn attract more DeFi oriented users.

The key metrics are indirect (not measurable), such as powerful solutions to the issues ETH based DeFi faces, as well as ports of these to Cardano. Due to the impact the proposal can make, I will not deduct from the score lack of metrics. It would be beneficial to add anticipated savings, or other value that would describe why this solution is superior.

Cardano can only benefit from such novel solutions built from the ground up in a better way.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer has demonstrated extreme and detailed knowledge for this development, presented public YouTube interview as well as current state of the DEX development.

The proposer is also an highly educated individual with sufficient skills and experience to deliver.

The presented plan is reasonable, both in scope and budget. Budget is consisting of working hours and is moderate in amount. The tasks to be performed are defined with the time estimates and persons are already part of the team.

Based on the provided info, it is highly likely that the project will be implemented.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has a clear roadmap, steps, budget, time estimate and deliverables.

The problem to be addressed and solution is very complex but clear, with the all the information presented in good order.

The potential risks and challenges are not particularity addressed. It would be beneficial to see the potential roadblocks and ways to mitigate them, such as wrong time estimates, unexpected problems or similar.

Expansion on the Metrics/KPI to measure the success would be beneficial, such as expected number of users or value saved in global sense.

However, the progress can be audited based on milestones to be achieved (1-3-6-12) so no points will be deducted.

f6_assessments.q0: DEXes are essential part of DeFi ecosystem on every blockchain. Having one with innovative functions like alhorithmic swaps instead of "traditional" uniswap-like solutions is a huge plus. Such solutions introduced with proper approach could result in strengthening Cardano position as an innovative blockchain with university-class products, and judging by a very descriptive proposal there is a lot of knowledge within this team.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer's experience seems to be more than enough to carry out such project. The way this proposal is written gives a positive feeling that this man would gather a team of real professionals around him to help bringing his vision to life. This proposal is not only descriptive but also educative for a reader like me, that further ensures me that it should be a success. Running a stake pool is a plus as a proof of dedication to Cardano.
f6_assessments.q2: Proper roadmap with definition of success is present. In addition, the website brings additional information and is well designed.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem description and solution are reasonable and within the scope of the challenge.

DEXs are DeFi's most popular dapps, they are at the top of the list when they are valued in volume and number of transactions. Observing sites like defipulse.com it is possible to attest to the fact that the TVL (total value locked) of DEXs is already over $10 billion dollars, indicating the great potential of this niche in DeFi and blockchains in general, so the concept has great potential and alignment with the challenge.

It should be noted that DEXs that use the constant-function market maker model are excellent to provide liquidity to those who want to use a DEX to do swaps, but sacrifice LPs (liquidity providers) due to impermanent loss.

The idea of ​​bringing in alternative models to mitigate impermanent loss is welcome and can benefit LPs(liquidity providers) and create alternative models.

It is also important that solutions have been identified for the concurrency problem, as the development of DEXs on Cardano brings programming paradigms different from those on Ethereum, this is due to the EUTXO model inherent to Cardano.

Overall, the proposal seeks to resolve different inefficiencies in the DeFi market, such as those present in the AMM-CFMM, order book model and arbitration models. These market niches are extremely relevant and important to DeFi.

The goals described in the timeline are within the deadline established in the challenge, but KPIs/metrics that can properly measure the impact through numbers were not included. I recommend including dapp usage estimates/benchmarks over time.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposer described extensive experience in economics, financial markets, programming (Plutus, Haskell) and the EUTXO model. There is mention of the participation of 2 developers, a graphic designer and a marketing employee. I recommend including sources for team qualification.

The proposer is also a SPO in the community, operating the MAL pool.

It is important to note that DEX is already under development and the proposer has already allocated funds even before receiving funding, indicating commitment.

The budget breakdown was carried out and is associated with the hourly rate for project development. The values ​​shown are reasonable and are within what is expected for Haskell+front end devs developers.

There is a reasonable timeline for developing DEX implementations.

There is an extensive rationale for technical and conceptual aspects of the project.

The risk of concurrency was addressed, as well as the particularities of different economic models to be evaluated and used.
f6_assessments.q2:
There is clarity in the problem, in the solution presented and in their alignment with the challenge.

A roadmap with reasonable milestones was included. The absence of metrics and KPIs makes autitability difficult, I recommend including these.

f6_assessments.q0: DEX's are weekend projects for experienced developers so the real and competitive value add comes from market knowledge and developing advanced features
f6_assessments.q1: Team has excellent history and has technical ability to execute. Glewellin provides comprehensive answers to questions on Discord. Very educational. Team possesses technical skills and market knowledge.
f6_assessments.q2: Team is very active in the community. Roadmap is published. Status updates are given frequently. Glewellin always available for questions.

f6_assessments.q0: This kind of in-depth research, development, testing and deployment is sorely needed for Cardano. It is in line with Cardano methodology, but also when things like these get deployed, they work and it can be proven they work. This would ease the minds of developers and projects coming to Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal itself reveals deep understanding of both Cardano eUTXO model and dynamics of financial instruments. Comparisons with Uniswap show research already done on existing solutions. Proposers experience is extensive and clearly stated.
f6_assessments.q2: Milestones are included, timeline is more or less clear. I would like to see a bit more details about milestones and progress.
